resources.string: Learn Java from the beginning. Start with the basics and progress to more advanced topics.
Learn Java from the beginning. Start with the basics and progress to more advanced topics.
Install Java and everything you need. Learn about variables, conditionals, user input and more.
Start with the basics. Install Java and everything you need. Learn about variables, conditionals, user input and more. At the end of this chapter, you should be capable of building simple apps.

"

To start learning, you'll first have to install Java. For beginners, an IDE is also recommended. This is what you'll do in this lesson:

1. Download and Install Java

2. Download and Install an IDE

3. Write your first Java program

In the following sections, you will be guided step by step on how to do these. Tap continue to get started!

"

"

We'll start by downloading and installing Java. This tutorial applies for computers running Windows x64. You'll download Java SE Development Kit 8.

1. Go to the Java download webpage
2. Select Accept License Agreement
3. Click on the filename jdk-8u191-windows-x64.exe (click the red down arrow)
4. Run the downloaded executable and follow the onscreen instructions.

Java will now be installed on your computer. After it is done, you are theoretically ready to make Java programs.

However, in the next section, you'll also learn how to download and install an IDE. An Integrated Development Environment is recommended for beginners.

"

"

An Integrated Development Environment (IDE) is a software that makes writing programs easier. You get syntax highlighting, code suggestions, your code is validated as you type and building and running your program is faster and easier. For beginners, these features are very helpful in the learning process.

For Java development we are going to use Eclipse. Eclipse is currently one of the most popular IDEs and possibly the most used one at the time of writing this.

So let's download and install it. Remember, we are downloading the version for Windows x64. Tap next to continue.

"

"

First, go to the Eclipse download page. You can access the download page by typing eclipse.org/downloads in your browser's bar.

Look for the Download button (it's a small orange button). Another page might open and you might have to click the Download button once again. After the setup file has finished downloading, run it.

After a few seconds (it might take longer if your computer is slow) the EclipseInstaller window appears. Choose the Eclipse IDE for Java Developers. Afterwards, you can click the INSTALL button.

"
